author: MF Milano Finanza
title: Papa Francesco resta in condizioni critiche, emersa lieve insufficienza renale
text:
Le condizioni di Papa Francesco «permangono critiche» nella giornata del 23 febbraio. Dalla giornata più critica dall’inizio del suo ricovero il 14 febbraio scorso, «non ha presentato ulteriori crisi respiratorie», ma la prognosi resta «riservata» vista la «complessità del quadro clinico, e l’attesa necessaria affinché le terapie farmacologiche possano dare qualche riscontro».
La novità, nella giornata del 23 febbraio, è l’emergere di una «lieve insufficienza renale» mostrata da alcune analisi. Questo l’aggiornamento serale della Santa Sede sulle condizioni di salute di Papa Francesco dopo il decimo giorno di ricovero all’ospedale Gemelli: «ha effettuato le due unità di emazie concentrate con beneficio e con risalita del valore di emoglobina. Stabile è rimasta la piastrinopenia; tuttavia alcuni esami sanguigni dimostrano una iniziale, lieve, insufficienza renale, allo stato sotto controllo. Prosegue l’ossigenoterapia ad alti flussi attraverso le cannule nasali. Il Santo Padre continua ad essere vigile e ben orientato. La complessità del quadro clinico, e l’attesa necessaria affinché le terapie farmacologiche possano dare qualche riscontro, impongono che la prognosi resti riservata».
La notte tra il 22 e il 23 febbraio era «trascorsa tranquilla, il Papa ha riposato», ha reso noto nella mattina del 23 febbraio la sala stampa della Santa Sede. Ma, a quanto si apprende da fonti vaticane, anche nella mattinata di domenica il Santo Padre ha continuato ad usare l’ossigeno ad alti flussi al quale ha fatto ricorso in occasione di una crisi respiratoria più prolungata del solito che si è verificata sabato 22 febbraio.
Il Pontefice che, come riferito sempre dalla Santa Sede, «presso l’appartamento allestito al 10° piano, ha partecipato alla Santa Messa, insieme a quanti in questi giorni di degenza si prendono cura di lui», continua a lavorare.
Francesco, infatti, questa domenica non si è visto, ma ha fatto arrivare la sua voce tramite tre scritti. Il primo l’omelia indirizzata ai Diaconi per l’evento Giubilare loro dedicato. Nell’occasione il Papa ha rimarcato l’essenzialità del perdono perché un «mondo dove per gli avversari c’è solo odio è un mondo senza speranza, senza futuro, destinato ad essere dilaniato da guerre».
Il secondo intervento di giornata del Papa è stato all’Angelus. Qui il Santo Padre si è detto «fiducioso» per il percorso di recupero. Poi ha indirizzato il pensiero alla guerra in Ucraina e agli altri conflitti di questa «Terza Guerra Mondiale a pezzi»: «Si compie domani il terzo anniversario della guerra su larga scala contro l’Ucraina: una ricorrenza dolorosa e vergognosa per l'intera umanità! Mentre rinnovo la mia vicinanza al martoriato popolo ucraino, vi invito a ricordare le vittime di tutti i conflitti armati e a pregare per il dono della pace in Palestina, in Israele e in tutto il Medioriente, in Myanmar, nel Kivu e in Sudan».
Infine il pensiero alle tante lettere e ai tanti disegni dei bambini che hanno «colpito» il Papa. Un pensiero di ringraziamento che Francesco ha espresso anche a mezzo social tornando a postare su X dopo una settimana.
Insomma, c’è da aspettare per comprendere l’evoluzione dello stato delle cose. Intanto è scattata la mobilitazione con la preghiera per la salute del Papa. Da Bologna, dove il cardinale Zuppi ha guidato un rosario, ad Assisi passando per Roma, Torino e Palermo. Tutti pregano per il Papa.(riproduzione riservata)
In questi giorni mi sono giunti tanti messaggi di affetto e mi hanno particolarmente colpito le lettere e i disegni dei bambini. Grazie per questa vicinanza e per le preghiere di conforto che ho ricevuto da tutto il mondo! — Papa Francesco (@Pontifex_it)
[February 23, 2025]

author: Lesli Dendy
title: Where Will Asbestos Attorney Mesothelioma 1 Year From Now?
text:
How to Choose an Asbestos Attorney for Your Mesothelioma Case
Mesothelioma is a debilitating illness caused by asbestos is the result of asbestos exposure. It was a popular building material prior to when companies started hiding the risks.
A mesothelioma lawyer can help family members and patients receive compensation through asbestos trust funds. When selecting an attorney for victims, they must be aware of the following:
Find a firm that has a presence Nationwide
It is recommended to select an asbestos lawyer with experience handling national cases and specializes in mesothelioma. Mesothelioma lawyers at national firms typically have a network of attorneys across the country. They are able to more quickly determine when, where, and how you were exposed to asbestos. They have access to specialized tools, such as asbestos product databases and old case records. Additionally, companies with a national presence have worked with a variety of local courts. This can help them develop large lawsuits and get quickly through the legal system.
A mesothelioma lawyer firm should be licensed to practice in your state and possess a thorough understanding of state laws. Most often, mesothelioma lawsuits are filed in a variety of states and the laws of each state differ. A firm that is nationwide can provide the advantage of knowing the laws and regulations of each state, as well as the intricate statutes.
It is also essential to find an attorney with experience handling cases for victims with diverse backgrounds. Mesothelioma patients are from a variety of industries and have different experiences. A mesothelioma attorney should be able help victims choose the most effective legal strategy to receive the amount of compensation they deserve.
Finally, it is essential to locate an asbestos lawyer who can comprehend the impact Mesothelioma Lawsuit has on the victims and their families. Attorneys must be compassionate and empathic towards their clients and listen to their concerns or queries. They should also be able explain complicated legal concepts in easy-to-understand terms.
The best mesothelioma lawyers will have years of experience fighting for asbestos victims and families. They’ll be able to identify any potential liability-prone parties (such as asbestos producers or insurers) and negotiate a settlement to ensure that they get you the compensation that you require. In addition, they should be able to comprehend the mesothelioma effects on victims and their families, and are prepared to fight for the compensation they are entitled to.
Look for Experience
If you are looking for a mesothelioma attorney, ensure you find one who has a lot of experience and an impressive track record. Check out their website to find out how long they’ve been in operation and what types of cases they have handled. You can also request references from past clients and community groups.
Mesothelioma can be a complex disease that requires a lot of knowledge of asbestos litigation. Experienced attorneys can ensure that you receive the compensation that you deserve. They will know how to calculate the value of your claim. They will ensure that you receive a sum that covers both your previous and future damages.
A lawyer with experience can also help you identify potential sources of exposure. It can be difficult to determine the exact location and time you were first exposed. They will examine your past work experience and look for connections to other asbestos victims. They also have resources to hire experts, such as industrial hygiene specialists and medical experts.
A mesothelioma attorney with experience can also make a claim in your name prior to the deadlines for filing a lawsuit. They will also know which states’ laws provide the highest chances of receiving compensation. They will also be able to file for VA benefits or trust fund claims in the event of need.
Many of the companies responsible for asbestos exposure have gone bankrupt. Companies that dealt with asbestos often filed for bankruptcy to avoid being sued by mesothelioma sufferers. Due to this, a lot of victims were not compensated. A mesothelioma lawyer can assist victims in receiving compensation from trust funds that were set by these corporations.
Additionally veterans who were exposed to asbestos while in the military could be qualified for compensation through the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). A reputable mesothelioma law firm can assist victims in filing VA claims and mesothelioma lawsuits with their former employers. They can even help veterans get VA pension and health care benefits that they did not receive. This will help ensure that veterans and family members are treated after suffering from asbestos-related diseases.
Search for a firm that works on a contingency basis
In addition to finding the best lawyer for your situation It is important to find a lawyer that works on a contingency basis. This will ensure that your lawyer will be able to meet your needs first and will do everything they can to get you the amount you are due. If your lawyer loses your case there will be no cost. This setup puts your best interests first and can help you get the mesothelioma compensation that you deserve and need.
Mesothelioma lawyers have access to resources that many other attorneys don’t have access to, including asbestos databases and experts. They also know how to properly examine a mesothelioma case and that includes determining a victim’s work history and connecting it to potential exposure events that could have occurred years ago.
An attorney for mesothelioma can also help determine the most appropriate legal claim for their clients. There are four kinds of mesothelioma lawsuits that include personal injury lawsuits; wrongful-death lawsuits asbestos trust fund claims and mesothelioma VA lawsuits. Personal injury lawsuits can be filed by mesothelioma sufferers or their families members to obtain financial compensation from companies who are accountable for their exposure to asbestos. The lawsuits for wrongful death are filed by relatives of victims who have passed away due to asbestos exposure, and these lawsuits are filed on behalf of the estate of the victim.
Asbestos trusts are created by asbestos-related companies who have gone bankrupt or dissolved to pay claims for asbestos-related illnesses. These claims are usually resolved through settlements or jury awards. Additionally mesothelioma VA benefits are available for military veterans who have been diagnosed with an asbestos-related disease like mesothelioma.
It is essential to find mesothelioma attorneys immediately when you’ve been exposed to asbestos. Asbestos attorneys have the connections and expertise to hire mesothelioma experts such as industrial hygienists or medical experts. They will also have the ability to file your case in the appropriate court jurisdiction. In addition, they will be able to identify any procedural mistakes that could compromise your case and hinder your ability to receive the compensation that you deserve.
Find a firm that offers a no-cost case evaluation
If you or someone you know has been diagnosed with an asbestos-related disease such as mesothelioma, an experienced asbestos lawyer can assist you to recover compensation from negligent parties. Compensation could be derived from an asbestos company or a fund for victims established, and also from an insurance company.
The first step is to locate an attorney who offers a no-cost case evaluation. This will assist you in making an informed decision about legal representation. Once you have a short list of lawyers you are considering, interview them and pay attention to their communication and responsiveness. Make sure you know the amount they charge and if there are other fees related to your case.
A knowledgeable mesothelioma attorney will ensure that your legal rights are protected and you receive the maximum amount of compensation. They can help you determine the best type of claim to file and the companies that should be held liable. They can also explain the litigation process and how to negotiate an agreement.
Asbestos lawyers can be hired on an hourly basis, which means that they only receive compensation if they win the case. This is a better option than hiring an hourly lawyer and it can save you a lot of money.
The majority of asbestos lawsuits settle out of court. However, a handful of cases go to trial, resulting in significant verdicts. A reputable New York team of mesothelioma lawyers has a vast trial experience, which helps them secure more substantial settlements.
Additionally, New York attorneys have extensive networks and connections with the top mesothelioma experts and researchers. This can increase the quality and result of your case.
Mesothelioma victims in New York can benefit from mesothelioma lawyers who have demonstrated results and vast experience in asbestos-related cases. They are known for securing multi-million dollar settlements and securing six-figure payments through asbestos trust funds.
Veterans who were exposed in multiple states to asbestos may be entitled to compensation. This could include ongoing disability benefits from the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) as well as payments from a veterans’ disability fund and compensation from responsible asbestos-related companies in a personal injury lawsuit.

author: NTM / EP
title: Las alertas por fuertes lluvias se activarán este sábado en Valencia, Cataluña y Baleares
text:
Las alertas por fuertes lluvias se activarán este sábado en la Comunitat Valenciana, Cataluña y Baleares, según la predicción de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet).
En concreto, Mallorca y Menorca activarán alertas naranjas hasta el amanecer y Tarragona mantendrá esta misma alerta durante toda la jornada por el mismo fenómeno, mientras que Barcelona y Girona contarán con alertas amarillas durante la madrugada por lluvias y fenómenos costeros.
En la Comunidad Valenciana, la provincia de Castellón mantendrá la alerta amarilla por fuertes durante todo el día, en tanto que Alicante y Valencia activarán alertas amarillas por lluvias durante las primeras horas de la madrugada.
Aemet ha puesto el foco en la previsión de chubascos y tormentas fuertes y persistentes en el sur y litorales de Cataluña, Castellón y Baleares, así como a primeras horas en zonas del sur de la Comunitat Valenciana, pudiendo llegar a ser muy fuertes en el entorno del bajo Ebro y nordeste del archipiélago; ligado a esto, se esperan intervalos fuertes de viento en puntos del litoral catalán.
En un plano general, la agencia ha apuntado que se prevé que se produzca una transición hacia una situación de mayor estabilidad, si bien han recordado que la DANA aún dejará precipitaciones en Andalucía occidental y oeste de Alborán, además del ya mencionado nordeste del país.
También son posibles chubascos dispersos en el resto de Andalucía, Murcia, ambas mesetas y montañas del extremo norte, mientras que en Canarias predominarán los intervalos nubosos tendiendo a aumentar, con probabilidad de dejar chubascos dispersos en las islas montañosas.
En lo referente a las temperaturas, las máximas irán en aumento en el suroeste peninsular y descenderán en litorales cantábricos y entorno de la Ibérica oriental-bajo Ebro, en tanto que las mínimas bajarán ligeramente por lo general, con posibles heladas débiles en cumbres de Pirineos y Sierra Nevada.
Sobre los vientos, la Aemet ha pronosticado que predominarán de componente este en la Península y Baleares, en general flojos en interiores y más intensos en litorales, con probables intervalos de fuerza en el Estrecho junto al ya mencionado litoral catalán.
En Canarias soplarán vientos flojos predominando las componentes norte y este, y tendiendo a rolar a suroeste en las islas occidentales.

author: The Hindu Bureau
title: Elected representatives of Shivamogga complain over poor BSNL services
text:
People’s representatives of Shivamogga expressed unhappiness over poor BSNL cellphone services both in rural and urban localities of Shivamogga district on Friday.
Taking part in the District Development Coordination and Monitoring Committee (DISHA) meeting in Shivamogga, Lok Sabha member B.Y. Raghavendra, legislators Araga Jnanendra, S.N. Channabasappa, and Sharada Puryanaik put out a series of complaints against the BSNL services.
Tirthahalli MLA Araga Jnanendra, expressing anger over poor services in the taluk, stated that it was better to close down BSNL. “We people’s representatives are struggling to get BSNL towers sanctioned to the rural areas. But phones do not connect even if I stand just below the tower,” he said. The former Minister pointed out that the company’s poor service is forcing him to relinquish the BSNL connection and take up some private connection. “Now cellphone connectivity is so important that we cannot do anything without that. I am fed up with complaints from people regarding the services,” he stated.
Forget rural areas; Shivamogga MLA S.N. Channabasappa intervened; even in urban localities, the BSNL service was no better. “I have been using BSNL SIM for many years, not interested in porting to private service. But the service is bad. I am not getting connectivity either at my home or in my office in Shivamogga city. When you cannot provide better service in the city, how can the rural people expect service from you?” he wondered.
Lok Sabha member Raghavendra, who chaired the meeting, informed that he got 141 towers sanctioned to the district to improve the network coverage. No other district in the State has got so many towers sanctioned. However, the service rendered by the company was not satisfactory. “The Union government has been strengthening the BSNL with additional funds. If the officers do not maintain the systems, it will not benefit the people,” he stated.
Of the 141 towers sanctioned, the work with regard to 63 had not begun due to the delay in getting forest clearance. Among 55 towers located in revenue land, the work with regard to 46 had been completed and 12 were operational, said Venkatesh, DGM (Admin) of BSNL. He maintained that the tower installation would be completed in rural areas as and when the department obtained clearance from the Forest Department.
Legislators Bilkis Banu, Dhananjay Sarji, D.S. Arun, Deputy Commissioner Gurudatta Hegade, Zilla Panchayat CEO N. Hemanth, Superintendent of Police G.K. Mithun Kumar, and others were present.
Published - November 15, 2024 07:12 pm IST

author: Sam Greenway
title: Storm Gerrit: Roads closed due to flooding in Worcestershire | Worcester News
text: ROADS in Worcestershire are closed due to flooding this morning, (December 29). In the aftermath of the heavy rain from Storm Gerrit some roads have seen standing water in places while others have had to be closed completely as it is impossible to navigate through. Worcestershire Highways list on the county website currently includes: - Eckington Bridge - Eckington Road, Birlingham closed between New Barn Road Birlingham and New Road Junction Eckington - Follow Black Hollow Square Diversion - Severn Side South, Bewdley, U10500 closed - Mill Lane, Hanley Castle - New Street, Upton Upon Severn closed Between The Old Fire Station to The Fruit Farm U61204 junction Stocks Lane, Newlands and Bransford Court Lane, Bransford, which were listed as being closed on the county council website on Thursday are currently not featured on the list. Worcestershire Highways also tweeted a picture of Sherridge Road, between Smith End Green and Leigh Sinton, last night which showed flooding there - but that road is also not on the current list. author: Myles Henderson
title: First Warning Forecast: Heat index near 110, Severe storm threat
text: Meteorologist Myles Henderson’s First Warning Forecast Extreme heat and humidity. Several chances for scattered showers and storms through the weekend. Highs will return to the mid 90s today with an afternoon heat index near 110. We will see partly cloudy skies with scattered showers and storms developing this afternoon to evening. Some storms could be strong to severe with heavy rain and gusty winds. More of the same for Saturday with highs in the mid 90s and an afternoon heat index near 110. Expect a mix of clouds with scattered showers and storms. Some storms could be strong to severe. A slight break on Sunday as highs dip to the upper 80s. It will still be muggy so the afternoon heat index will be near 100. Expect a mix of clouds with scattered showers and storms. Highs will settle in the mid to upper 80s for the first part of next week. It will still be hot and humid, but not as extreme as the end of this week. Today: Partly Cloudy, Scattered Storms. Highs in the mid 90s. Winds: SW 5-15 Tonight: Partly Cloudy. Lows in the upper 70s. Winds: S 5-10 Tomorrow: Partly Cloudy, Scattered Storms. Highs in the mid 90s. Winds: SW 10-15 Tropical Update Tracking a well-defined tropical wave over Hispaniola and eastern Cuba. The wave is expected to move near or over Cuba throughout the day and then emerge over the Straits of Florida tonight or Saturday. Environmental conditions are expected to be conducive for additional development after that time. A tropical depression is likely to form this weekend over the Straits of Florida or eastern Gulf of Mexico near the Florida Peninsula. * Formation chance through 48 hours: Medium (50%) * Formation chance through 7 days: High (80%) Weather & Health Pollen: Medium (Grasses) UV Index: 9 (Very High) Air Quality: Moderate (Code Yellow) Mosquitoes: Extreme Weather updates on social media: Facebook: [MylesHendersonWTKR](https://www.facebook.com/MylesHendersonWTKR) Instagram: [@MylesHendersonWTKR](https://www.instagram.com/myleshendersonwtkr/) X (Twitter): [@MHendersonWTKR](http://www.twitter.com/MHendersonWTKR)
